facts.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
Don’t wait for opportunity. Create it.
Love is not about how much you say ‘I love you,’ but how much you prove that it’s true.
The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
Love is when the other person’s happiness is more important than your own.
To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
Love is a friendship set to music.
The giving of love is an education in itself.
The best proof of love is trust.
Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
We accept the love we think we deserve.
In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
Your life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
Life isn’t about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans.
Difficulties in life are intended to make us better, not bitter.
The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful.
Life is short, and it’s up to you to make it sweet.
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
Happiness is the secret to all beauty. There is no beauty without happiness.
The key to being happy is knowing you have the power to choose what to accept and what to let go.
Happiness is a state of mind. It’s just according to the way you look at things.
The only thing that will make you happy is being happy with who you are.
Happiness is not a goal...it’s a by-product of a life well-lived.
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
The secret of success is to do the common thing uncommonly well.
Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving.
Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
Success is not about being the best. It’s about always getting better.
Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day-in and day-out.
The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
Introverts often feel more energized by spending time alone or with a small group of close friends.
Introverts may excel in environments that require deep thinking and focus.
Introverts tend to listen more than they speak and often think before they talk.
Introverts may feel drained after social interactions and need time alone to recharge.
Introverts are often introspective and enjoy exploring their own thoughts and feelings.
Introverts can be highly creative and innovative, often coming up with unique solutions.
Introverts value meaningful conversations over small talk.
Introverts often prefer written communication, such as emails or texts, over phone calls.
Introverts are typically more reserved and may take longer to open up to others.
Introverts can form deep, lasting relationships with a few close friends.
Extroverts often feel more energized by being around other people and engaging in social activities.
Extroverts tend to enjoy being the center of attention and are often more outgoing.
Extroverts may thrive in environments that involve teamwork and collaboration.
Extroverts often think out loud and may make decisions quickly.
Extroverts are usually comfortable with public speaking and large gatherings.
Extroverts may feel bored or restless when alone for long periods.
Extroverts are often good at networking and building large social circles.
Extroverts tend to seek out excitement and new experiences.
Extroverts may be more likely to take risks and seek adventure.
Extroverts often enjoy leading group activities and organizing social events.
Silence can help to reduce stress and promote relaxation.
Periods of silence can enhance creativity and problem-solving abilities.
Silence allows for deep reflection and self-awareness.
Practicing silence can improve concentration and focus.
Silence can enhance listening skills and empathy towards others.
Spending time in silence can improve mental clarity and decision-making.
Silence can help to process emotions and reduce negative thinking.
Regular silence practices can improve overall well-being and mental health.
Silence can provide a break from constant stimulation and allow for inner peace.
Silence can foster a deeper connection with oneself and the environment.
Intelligence is not fixed and can be developed through learning and experience.
People with high emotional intelligence are often better at managing relationships and social situations.
Intelligence can manifest in various forms, including logical, linguistic, spatial, and interpersonal.
Curiosity and a love of learning are often associated with high intelligence.
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are key components of intelligence.
Intelligence can be influenced by both genetic and environmental factors.
People with high intelligence often have a strong sense of self-discipline and perseverance.
Intelligence can be nurtured through mental exercises and continuous learning.
Creative thinking is a sign of high intelligence and often leads to innovative ideas.
Intelligence is not just about academic achievement; it includes practical and social intelligence as well.
Personality traits can influence behavior, thoughts, and emotions.
The Big Five personality traits are openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, and neuroticism.
Personality is shaped by a combination of genetic and environmental factors.
Introversion and extraversion are key aspects of personality that influence social interactions.
Personality can change over time, especially with significant life experiences.
People with similar personalities may gravitate towards similar interests and activities.
Understanding personality can help improve relationships and communication.
Personality assessments can provide insights into strengths and areas for growth.
Different personality types may handle stress and conflict in various ways.
Personality can impact career choices and job satisfaction.
It can store an estimated 2,500,000 gigabytes.
The human attention span is shorter than a goldfish.
The average weight of the adult human brain is three pounds.
Memories are stored for both short-term and long-term use at the same time.
Vitamin B1 can help improve short- and long-term memory.
Easy access to information can make it harder to remember.
Memories start forming in the womb.
It uses 20% of the body’s total oxygen and energy.
It’s composed of 73% water.
Sweating can temporarily shrink the brain.
Five minutes without oxygen can cause brain damage.
It generates 12-15 watts of electricity.
Neurons travel 150 mph in the brain.
Those who take a quiz twice are 65% more likely to remember the facts.
Learning new things increases grey matter in the brain.
Memory is prioritized by emotion.
Emotions can alter our brain chemistry.
It has an average of 50,000-70,000 thoughts a day.
More than 100,000 chemical reactions take place in the brain every second.
When intoxicated, it can’t form memories.
Practicing recollection can help with PTSD.
Its texture and consistency are comparable to tofu.
It starts slowing at around 24 years old.
95% of all decisions are subconscious.
The brain itself cannot feel pain.
